attributes.action: Capping away football tickets to £20 for adults and £5 for under 16s.
attributes.additional_details: To introduce a fair pricing policy across the football league so that all clubs have the same rules and procedures when it comes to charging visiting supporters to football games.
attributes.background: Football was always the working mans sport and is being influenced by corporate money men making the sport unattainable for the average working family. Some clubs are charging up to £20 for children so a family of 4 are paying £100 minimum for a day of entertainment.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament is responsible for.

Decisions about the cost of ticket prices are a matter for the FA and individual football clubs, not the Government or Parliament.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.
